Key Match Events: The White Sox blew leads in the eighth, 10th, and 11th innings before Jairo Iriarte surrendered a walk-off RBI single to Jordyn Adams in the bottom of the 13th to send Chicago to a 4-3 loss to the Angels.
Justin Anderson surrendered a game-tying RBI single to Taylor Ward in the eighth inning.
Chad Kuhl allowed a game-tying RBI single to Gustavo Campero in the 10th inning.
Chad Kuhl served up another game-tying single to Eric Wagaman in the 11th inning.
Yoán Moncada struck out to leave the bases loaded in the top of the 13th inning.
Jairo Iriarte allowed the winning run after Jordyn Adams’ bouncer to the left side kicked off the glove of a sliding Miguel Vargas, scoring Eric Wagaman.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore commented, 'We had some opportunities, just didn't capitalize. I think a couple mistakes, too, that could have gone a different way and helped us out.'
Andrew Vaughn reflected, 'That was a tough game out there. Back and forth in extras. We'd score, they'd score. We just didn't put them away right there.'
Grady Sizemore stated, 'We’re focused on just one series at a time, one game at a time. Everything else is irrelevant right now. We're just trying to get better and win games.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox have lost 22 games in which they led after six innings, a major reason why they’re approaching the record for most losses in a season.
The White Sox bullpen has a 4.79 ERA, second-worst in the American League.
The day began on a high note for the White Sox relief corps as Jared Shuster, Gus Varland, and Prelander Berroa combined for seven scoreless innings to start a scheduled bullpen game.
